bug.author: jarib
bug.summary: Inconsistent return value type for .vector on GPU
bug.description:
Using a GPU, the return value of .vector is inconsistent depending on whether the token in question has a vector or not. Example: <denchmark-code>>>> type(nlp('test').vector) <class 'cupy.core.core.ndarray'> >>> type(nlp('testasdasdasd').vector) <class 'numpy.ndarray'> </denchmark-code>
spaCy version: 2.2.2 Platform: Linux-5.0.0-1026-gcp-x86_64-with-Ubuntu-18.04-bionic Python version: 3.6.8

comments.comment: Thanks for the report! This is a duplicate of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/4673>#4673</denchmark-link> and has been fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/pull/4680>#4680</denchmark-link> .
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
